terms.definition: Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a service provider and accessed via the internet
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to revert to previous versions and compare modifications
A pre-designed document format or structure that can be reused and customized for creating consistent documentation across projects
The ability for multiple users to work on the same document simultaneously with changes visible instantly to all participants
A software system that runs on remote servers accessed via the internet rather than on local computers or servers
The process of connecting different software systems or tools to work together and share data seamlessly
A defined sequence of steps or processes that automate and standardize how tasks are completed within a system
The ability to track and document the history, location, and changes of information or processes throughout their lifecycle
The process of establishing uniform formats, procedures, or criteria to ensure consistency across documentation and processes
Printed Circuit Board - a board that mechanically supports and electrically connects electronic components using conductive tracks
Formal records and reports that demonstrate adherence to regulatory requirements, industry standards, and legal obligations
Technical writing that explains how to effectively use and integrate with an Application Programming Interface
The process of inputting information into a computer system or database, often manually through forms or interfaces
A cyclical process where output or results are used as input for improvement, creating continuous refinement of processes or products
